alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin; Sherburne; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:11PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hennepin, east central Wright, northwestern Anoka and eastern Sherburne Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 211 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Lake, or 17 miles northeast of Buffalo, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... St. Francis around 220 PM CDT. Elk River around 225 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Albertville, Andover, Ramsey, Anoka, St. Michael and Otsego. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 198 and 205. U.S. Highway 10 in Minnesota between mile markers 204 and 217. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 159 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
